traversalConstraints.sourceText: [{'condition': 'Subject experiences a flare', 'path': ['OPEN_LABEL_RESCUE_TREATMENT', 'RESCUE_WEEK_0', 'RESCUE_WEEK_8', 'RESCUE_WEEK_12', 'RESCUE_WEEK_16']}, {'condition': 'Subject in high-risk TB region (>10/100,000 prevalence)', 'path': ['ONE_YEAR_EXPOSURE', 'REPEAT_TB_TEST']}, {'condition': 'HBV DNA result above LLQ (China/Taiwan only)', 'path': ['IMMEDIATE_PERMANENT_DISCONTINUATION', 'EARLY_TERMINATION']}]

executionTypes.rationale: Administered at all remaining scheduled visits in Run In, Blinded treatments, and specific Rescue weeks.
Performed at Screening to determine eligibility.
Conditional workflow triggered only if subject is HBsAg negative, HBcAb positive, and HBsAb positive at screening.
Repeated at specific intervals (Weeks 12, 28, 40, 52, etc.) for a specific subset of enrolled subjects.
Immediate and permanent discontinuation is triggered if a single HBV DNA test result is above the LLQ.
Collected at current PK sample time points for metabolite analysis.

footnoteConditions.text: a. Complete physical examinations must be performed by the investigator, sub investigator or a qualified health professional per local guidelines.
footnoteConditions.sourceText: a. Complete physical examinations must be performed by the investigator, sub investigator or a quali

footnoteConditions.text: b. Vital Signs include sitting blood pressure, pulse, respiratory rate, and temperature measured after at least 5 minutes of rest.
footnoteConditions.sourceText: b. Vital Signs include sitting blood pressure, pulse, respiratory rate, and temperature measured aft

footnoteConditions.text: c. Hematology includes: Hemoglobin, hematocrit, red blood cells, white blood cells, neutrophils (%, absolute), lymphocytes (%, absolute), monocytes (%, absolute), eosinophils (%, absolute), basophils (%, absolute), platelets, reticulocyte count, RBC Indices (MCH, MCHC, MCV, RBC Morphology), lymphocyte subsets and markers (Total T cells [CD3+], CD4+ T cells [CD3+CD4+], CD8+ T cells [CD3+CD8+], NK cells [CD3-CD16+CD56+], B cells [CD3-CD19 +).
footnoteConditions.sourceText: c. Hematology includes: Hemoglobin, hematocrit, red blood cells, white blood cells, neutrophils (%,

footnoteConditions.text: d. Coagulation panel includes: Activated Partial Thromboplastin Time (APTT), Prothrombin Time/International Normalized Ratio (PT/INR).
footnoteConditions.sourceText: d. Coagulation panel includes: Activated Partial Thromboplastin Time (APTT), Prothrombin Time/Intern

footnoteConditions.text: e. Serum chemistry includes: blood urea nitrogen (BUN), serum creatinine, creatine phosphokinase, glucose, Ca++, Na+, K+, Cl-, total CO2, aspartate aminotransferase (AST), alanine aminotransferase (ALT), gamma-glutamyl transferase (GGT), total, indirect and direct bilirubin, alkaline phosphatase, lactate dehydrogenase, uric acid, albumin and total protein.
footnoteConditions.sourceText: e. Serum chemistry includes: blood urea nitrogen (BUN), serum creatinine, creatine phosphokinase, gl

footnoteConditions.text: f. Urinalysis includes: pH, Glucose (qualitative), Protein (qualitative), Blood (qualitative), Ketones, Nitrites, Leukocyte esterase, Microscopy and/or culture (performed as appropriate).
footnoteConditions.sourceText: f. Urinalysis includes: pH, Glucose (qualitative), Protein (qualitative), Blood (qualitative), Keton

footnoteConditions.text: h. Lipid Panel includes: total cholesterol, low-density lipoprotein (LDL), high-density lipoprotein (HDL), and triglycerides. A minimum of 8-hour fasting is required for lipid profile evaluation at the following Rescue Visits: Day 1, Week 4, Week 12 and EOS visits.
footnoteConditions.sourceText: h. Lipid Panel includes: total cholesterol, low-density lipoprotein (LDL), high-density lipoprotein

footnoteConditions.text: i. Urine pregnancy test must be performed at every site visit prior to dosing with the investigational product for female subjects of childbearing potential including adolescents aged 12 years and older regardless of whether they have experienced menarche.
footnoteConditions.sourceText: i. Urine pregnancy test must be performed at every site visit prior to dosing with the investigation

footnoteConditions.text: j. Subjects should take the medication from study Days 1 to 85 of the rescue treatment. Subjects will be encouraged to take the medication in the morning whenever possible; however, at study visit days, subjects are to be instructed to refrain from dosing at home and are to take the dose in the clinic.
footnoteConditions.sourceText: j. Subjects should take the medication from study Days 1 to 85 of the rescue treatment. Subjects wil

footnoteConditions.text: k. Subjects who complete EOT will be assessed for eligibility for participation in long-term extension study B7451015 as noted in Section 6.5.7.
footnoteConditions.sourceText: k. Subjects who complete EOT will be assessed for eligibility for participation in long-term extensi

footnoteConditions.text: l. Pruritus Numerical Rating Scale (NRS) will be assessed using an eDiary, and will be collected daily in the eDiary from Study Days 1-15 during the rescue treatment and then only on study visit days at the investigative site thereafter. PSAAD will be completed daily (in selected countries) in the eDiary from Day 1 through the End of Study (EOS) visit during rescue treatment. At every visit, the study coordinator will review the eDiary for completeness and counsel the subject on how to complete the items in the daily eDiary, if needed.
footnoteConditions.sourceText: l. Pruritus Numerical Rating Scale (NRS) will be assessed using an eDiary, and will be collected dai

footnoteConditions.text: m. DLQI will be completed by adult subjects only. Adolescents 12-17 years of age will complete the CDLQI instead.
footnoteConditions.structuredCondition: if(subject.age >= 18) { activity = 'DLQI' } else if(subject.age >= 12 && subject.age <= 17) { activity = 'CDLQI' }
footnoteConditions.sourceText: m. DLQI will be completed by adult subjects only. Adolescents 12-17 years of age will complete the C

footnoteConditions.text: n. The EuroQol Quality of Life 5-Dimension 5-Level Scale (EQ-5D-5L) will be completed by adult subjects only. Adolescents 12-17 years of age will complete the EuroQol Quality of Life 5-Dimension, Youth Scale (EQ-5D-Y) in select countries.
footnoteConditions.sourceText: n. The EuroQol Quality of Life 5-Dimension 5-Level Scale (EQ-5D-5L) will be completed by adult subje

footnoteConditions.text: o. SF-36v2 will be completed by adult subjects only. Adolescents 12-17 years of age will not complete this assessment.
footnoteConditions.sourceText: o. SF-36v2 will be completed by adult subjects only. Adolescents 12-17 years of age will not complet

footnoteConditions.text: p. FACIT-F will be completed by adult subjects only. Adolescents 12-17 years of age will complete the Peds-FACIT-F instead.
footnoteConditions.sourceText: p. FACIT-F will be completed by adult subjects only. Adolescents 12-17 years of age will complete th

footnoteConditions.text: q. Collect weight for all subjects and height for adolescents only (12 to <18 years old).
footnoteConditions.sourceText: q. Collect weight for all subjects and height for adolescents only (12 to <18 years old).

footnoteConditions.text: r. Following one year of total exposure to study drug since the last TB test, all subjects in regions which are above a low-risk for Tuberculosis (ie, >10/100,000 prevalence) will undergo tuberculosis (TB) testing. A chest X-ray will be performed to aid in TB status determination for all adults, and recommended for adolescents according to local guidelines and standard of care in countries with a high incidence rate of TB.
footnoteConditions.sourceText: r. Following one year of total exposure to study drug since the last TB test, all subjects in region

footnoteConditions.text: s. In China and Taiwan only: For subjects who had HBV DNA testing at Screening, HBV DNA testing is repeated at Rescue Week 12 or at an early termination visit. A single positive HBV DNA test result above the LLQ for a subject requires immediate and permanent discontinuation from treatment. Refer to Section 7.6.2.1.
footnoteConditions.sourceText: s. In China and Taiwan only: For subjects who had HBV DNA testing at Screening, HBV DNA testing is r

footnoteConditions.text: t. Post-screening, if there are “yes” answers on items 4, 5 or on any behavioral question of the Since Last Visit C-SSRS a risk assessment by a qualified mental health professional (MHP) should be done to determine whether it is safe for the subject to continue to participate in the trial.

endpointAlgorithms.name: Primary: Efficacy of PF-04965842
endpointAlgorithms.algorithm: Comparison of PF-04965842 vs Placebo in subjects with moderate to severe atopic dermatitis
endpointAlgorithms.successCriteria: Statistically significant improvement in efficacy parameters compared to placebo
endpointAlgorithms.sourceText: A PHASE 3 RANDOMIZED WITHDRAWAL, DOUBLE-BLIND, PLACEBO-CONTROLLED, MULTI-CENTER STUDY INVESTIGATING THE EFFICACY AND SAFETY OF PF-04965842

endpointAlgorithms.name: Key Secondary Endpoint
endpointAlgorithms.algorithm: Not explicitly detailed in protocol summary; defined in Statistical Analysis Plan
endpointAlgorithms.successCriteria: Defined per-protocol analysis set major deviations
endpointAlgorithms.sourceText: Addition of Key Secondary endpoint... Clarified wording/group definitions and other clarification of endpoints.

endpointAlgorithms.name: Safety: Columbia Suicide Severity Rating Scale (C-SSRS)

timeWindow.duration: Run-In, Blinded treatment, and Rescue weeks 0, 8, 12, 16, EOT/ET, and EOS

endpointAlgorithms.algorithm: Occurrence of suicidal ideation or behavior as reported on the C-SSRS scale
endpointAlgorithms.successCriteria: Absence of treatment-emergent suicidal ideation or behavior
endpointAlgorithms.sourceText: The Columbia Suicide Severity Rating Scale (C-SSRS) will be administered to all ongoing subjects at all remaining scheduled visits... to align with new cross-program processes.

endpointAlgorithms.name: Safety: Hepatitis B Reactivation (Region Specific - China/Taiwan)
endpointAlgorithms.successCriteria: HBV DNA remains negative or below LLQ
endpointAlgorithms.sourceText: A single HBV DNA test result above the LLQ requires immediate and permanent discontinuation from treatment.

derivedVariables.name: Change from Baseline in C-SSRS
derivedVariables.baselineDefinition: Last assessment prior to the start of the Open-Label Run-In period
derivedVariables.analysisWindow: Run-In, Blinded Treatment, and Rescue Weeks 0, 8, 12, 16, EOT/ET, EOS

derivedVariables.name: HBV DNA Status
derivedVariables.derivationRule: If HBV DNA > LLQ then 'Positive/Above LLQ' else 'Negative/Below LLQ'
derivedVariables.baselineDefinition: Reflex testing at Screening for subjects with HBsAg negative, HBcAb positive, and HBsAb positive serology

transitions.trigger: Progress to Open Label Run In

dosingRegimens.durationDescription: Not explicitly stated in provided text
doseModifications: Subjects that discontinue study treatment will remain in the study and must have their end of treatment visit within 1 week after their last dose
